message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC 

The paper deals with trust management in the cloud-enabled Internet of Things (IoT) and discusses the vulnerability of cloud services to advanced persistent threats (APTs). This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a strategic trust mechanism that uses optimal control and game theory to quantify the utilities in the higher level games. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the communication layer and physical layer of the IoT, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of cloud services in the IoT, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category.
